Create a comprehensive Virtual Event Engagement Strategy and Run-of-Show for [EVENT NAME], a [EVENT TYPE: FUNDRAISING GALA/WORKSHOP/PANEL/TOWN HALL/CELEBRATION] hosted by [ORGANIZATION NAME] on [DATE/TIME/TIME ZONE] for [TARGET AUDIENCE(S)]. Format the output as a [OUTPUT FORMAT: Google Doc outline/Planning spreadsheet columns/Presentation outline/Plain text] with clear headings and bullet points. If any bracketed item is not finalized, use “TBD” and provide general best-practice guidance.

Output Structure: Generate a complete event package including: (1) Strategy overview (450-650 words), (2) Minute-by-minute run-of-show, (3) Scripts and talking points, (4) Technical/production checklist, and (5) Follow-up plan. Elements beyond the strategy overview are supplementary and not counted toward the word limit.

Event Parameters:
- Team size: [TEAM SIZE]
- Budget: [BUDGET RANGE]
- Platform: [ZOOM/TEAMS/WEBEX/OTHER]
- Expected attendance: [EXPECTED ATTENDEE COUNT]
- Speakers/presenters: [NUMBER AND FORMAT]
- Event history: [FIRST-TIME/ANNUAL/RECURRING]

Strategy Overview (450-650 words):
- One-sentence purpose statement
- Three SMART goals tied to mission outcomes (e.g., donor conversions, volunteer sign-ups, policy actions)
- How format and interactive elements support these goals
- Key accessibility and inclusion commitments (captioning/ASL, language access, visual contrast)

Minute-by-Minute Run-of-Show (75–90 minutes total):
- Detailed timeline with time stamps (e.g., 0:00–0:05 Welcome and land acknowledgment)
- Interactive touchpoints every 10–15 minutes (polls, chat prompts, breakouts, reactions, Q&A)
- Mark technical transitions, speaker handoffs, production cues, and buffer time
- Identify fundraising/CTA moments and countdown cues

Platform & Access Details:
- Registration flow and confirmation process (include calendar hold link)
- Donation button/link CTA: [CTA LINK]
- Accessibility: [CAPTIONING/ASL/OTHER NEEDS]; visual descriptions as needed
- Dial-in backup number and instructions
- Recording policy: [WILL RECORD AND SHARE/WILL RECORD FOR INTERNAL USE/NO RECORDING]; post-event access: [RECORDING AVAILABLE TO ALL/ATTENDEES ONLY/NOT AVAILABLE]
- Security settings (waiting room, rename, chat permissions)

Team Roles & Responsibilities:
- Emcee/Host: [EMCEE NAME/TITLE]—on-camera engagement and transitions
- Chat Moderator: curate questions, flag issues, post links
- Tech Lead: platform management, screen shares, troubleshooting, backup plan
- Speaker Wrangler: cues, timing, bios, green-room coordination
- Escalation protocol (3 steps): Tech Lead attempts fix → switch to backup (slides-only/dial-in) → Emcee acknowledges and pivots agenda

Pre-Event Communications:
- Registration confirmation email (100–150 words): event details, calendar hold, what to expect, accessibility info, platform download link
- 24-hour reminder (75–100 words): login link, “test your tech” note, what to have ready, teaser
- 1-hour day-of reminder (≤50 words): direct login link
- Subject lines for each email

Scripts & Talking Points:
- Opening (30–45 sec): welcome, purpose, what to expect
- Inclusive welcome/land acknowledgment (if appropriate)
- Donor/volunteer acknowledgment (20–30 sec): concise gratitude without long lists
- Mission story (60–90 sec): vivid, specific, outcome-tied narrative
- Closing (30–45 sec): thanks, next steps, clear CTAs

Interactive Elements:
- Polls: 2–3 multiple-choice questions (3–5 options each), timed with purpose noted (e.g., Poll 1 at 15:00 to gauge familiarity)
- Chat prompts: 3–5 exact questions (e.g., “Share your city,” “One action you’ll take this week?”)
- Breakout (optional, 5–7 min): clear prompt, roles, time warning, debrief plan
- Q&A flow: how to submit, moderation rules, time limits, spam/troll handling (mute/remove, chat limits)

Fundraising Moment:
- 90-sec story: who/what funds support and impact
- Specific ask: [FUNDRAISING GOAL] with tiers (e.g., $50 does X, $100 does Y)
- On-screen CTA with exact language and [CTA LINK]; note match if applicable [MATCH DETAILS or N/A]
- Plan B soft ask (≤30 sec) if short on time; follow-up giving instructions

Production Checklist:
- Audio: mic test, backup source, mute protocols
- Lighting/background: high contrast, quiet space, branded or neutral backdrop
- Slides: branded, large fonts (24pt+), high contrast, minimal text
- Accessibility: alt text for images in posted materials, captions/ASL integration
- Speaker tech checks (24–48 hrs prior): audio/video, screen share, backup slides, run-through
- Screen share permissions; backup deck with Tech Lead

Follow-Up Plan (within 48 hours):
- Segmented emails:
  - Attendees (150–200 words): thanks, recording link, survey, donation/next-step CTAs
  - No-shows (100–150 words): we missed you, recording, next opportunity
  - New donors (100–150 words): gratitude, impact, what’s next
- Survey (max 5 questions): overall rating, most valuable element, tech issues, future topics, likelihood to attend again
- Next-step CTAs by segment; 2–3 social recap posts with sample copy

Success Metrics (define targets):
- Registration-to-attendance conversion rate (target: [X]%)
- Retention rate: percentage who stay through the full event (target: [X]%)
- Engagement rate: percentage participating in polls/chat (target: [X]%)
- Q&A participation: questions submitted (target: [X])
- Donation/pledge conversions: percentage and dollars (target: [X]% / $[X])
- Survey response rate (target: [X]%)
- Post-event actions: clicks/sign-ups/shares (target: [X])

Tone & Voice:
Use [TONE: FORMAL/WARM/CASUAL] throughout. Attribute all host voice to [EMCEE NAME/TITLE] speaking directly to attendees.

Quality Standards:
- Concrete, copy-paste-ready guidance; natural, spoken-friendly scripts
- Realistic timings for small teams; interaction combats fatigue
- Accessibility built-in; CTAs specific and easy to act on

Avoid:
- Generic corporate language, long monologues (>2 min), filler phrases
- Technical jargon without explanation or complex platform admin steps
- Specialized A/V requirements beyond a basic laptop/webcam setup
- Overly ambitious timelines that create unnecessary stress

## Neighbors Nourish: Virtual Town Hall - Google Doc Outline

### **1. Strategy Overview**

**One-sentence purpose statement:** To foster a deeper connection between South Valley Mutual Aid Network and its community by celebrating shared impact, empowering local voices, and mobilizing support for farmworker families.

South Valley Mutual Aid Network's inaugural Virtual Town Hall, "Neighbors Nourish," aims to transcend the traditional virtual meeting by creating an engaging and inspiring space for our diverse community. Recognizing this is our first virtual event, our strategy prioritizes authenticity, accessibility, and clear calls to action, all while leveraging a lean budget and dedicated four-person team. We understand that effective virtual engagement hinges on clear communication, interactive elements, and a strong emotional connection to our mission. The event is designed to be warm, welcoming, and directly reflective of the grassroots nature of our work.

**Three SMART goals tied to mission outcomes:**

*   **Goal 1: Increase Volunteer Engagement:** To achieve a 20% increase in new volunteer sign-ups for food distribution and community support initiatives within two weeks following the event, measured by direct sign-ups via our post-event CTA and website traffic.
*   **Goal 2: Boost Small-Dollar Donor Contributions:** To raise $12,000 in donations during and immediately after the event, with an 8% donor conversion rate among attendees, specifically aiming to secure funds for at least 150 immediate relief packages for farmworker families.
*   **Goal 3: Enhance Community Connection & Feedback:** To achieve a 35% survey response rate from attendees, garnering actionable feedback on community needs and program effectiveness, and facilitating 15 unique questions during the live Q&A session, demonstrating active participant engagement and interest in our work.

**How format and interactive elements support these goals:**

The Town Hall format is deliberately structured to be dynamic and participatory, directly supporting our SMART goals. Instead of a passive broadcast, we're building an experience that invites active involvement. The inclusion of two live community storytellers will humanize our impact, making the connection between our volunteers, donors, and farmworker families palpable and inspiring. This direct, emotional appeal is crucial for driving volunteer sign-ups and donor contributions, as participants will see the tangible results of their support.

Interactive elements are strategically woven throughout the 90-minute agenda to combat virtual fatigue and maintain engagement. Quick polls (e.g., gauging familiarity with our work or community priorities) will provide instant feedback and make attendees feel heard, contributing to Goal 3. Chat prompts, such as "Share one action you'll take," will foster a sense of collective action and belonging, encouraging initial commitments towards Goal 1. A dedicated Q&A segment allows for direct interaction with our program director and community members, not only providing valuable information but also signaling to attendees that their voices matter. The fundraising moment, complete with a compelling impact story and a live match, directly targets Goal 2, making the ask clear, timely, and impactful. All these elements are designed to break up presentations, provide avenues for expression, and reinforce the event's purpose as a collaborative community gathering rather than a one-way lecture. The pre-recorded video will maintain momentum and add a professional touch while allowing for broader storytelling without timing constraints.

**Key accessibility and inclusion commitments:**

Our commitment to accessibility and inclusion is foundational to ensuring that "Neighbors Nourish" is truly for everyone in our community. We will utilize Zoom's built-in live auto-captioning feature throughout the event. A dedicated Spanish interpretation channel will be established, with clear instructions provided during registration and at the start of the event, ensuring language access for our Spanish-speaking farmworker families and community members. All presentation slides will adhere to high-contrast design principles with large, legible fonts (24pt or larger) and minimal text per slide. For any visual content, image descriptions will be provided in the chat by the Chat Moderator, and the Emcee/speakers will offer brief visual descriptions aloud where appropriate (e.g., "On the screen, you'll see a photo of..."). This comprehensive approach ensures that all attendees, regardless of their language, hearing, or visual abilities, can fully participate and engage with the content and conversations.

---

### **2. Minute-by-Minute Run-of-Show (90 minutes)**

**Platform & Access Details:**
*   **Registration flow and confirmation process:**
    *   Attendees register via a simple Zoom registration link.
    *   Confirmation email sent immediately post-registration.
    *   Email includes: unique Zoom login link, calendar hold (.ics file), brief "what to expect," accessibility info, and Zoom client download link.
*   **Donation button/link CTA:** https://svman.org/give
*   **Accessibility:**
    *   Zoom live auto-captioning enabled.
    *   Spanish interpretation channel set up (instructions in confirmation email & at start).
    *   High-contrast slides (24pt+ font, minimal text).
    *   Image descriptions for visuals (Chat Moderator, Emcee/speakers).
    *   Visual descriptions as needed.
*   **Dial-in backup number and instructions:** Provided in confirmation emails and chat at the start.
*   **Recording policy:** WILL RECORD AND SHARE; post-event access: ATTENDEES ONLY (link emailed within 48 hours).
*   **Security settings:**
    *   Waiting Room enabled (Tech Lead admits attendees).
    *   Participants can rename themselves.
    *   Chat permissions: Private messages only to Host/Co-hosts; public chat encouraged.

---

**0:00 – 0:05 (5 min) – Pre-Show Lobby & Welcome Message Loop**
*   **Visual:** Branded pre-event slide (logo, event title, date/time, "Event starts soon!").
*   **Audio:** Light, warm instrumental background music.
*   **Chat:** Moderator posts welcome message, accessibility reminders (captioning, interpretation), "Share your city!" prompt.
*   **Prod Cue:** Tech Lead admits attendees from waiting room.

**0:05 – 0:08 (3 min) – Welcome & Land Acknowledgment**
*   **Speaker:** Marisol Vega, Emcee
*   **Script:** Opening, Inclusive Welcome/Land Acknowledgment, Purpose Statement.
*   **Prod Cue:** Emcee on screen. Music fades out.
*   **Interactive:** Chat prompt: "What does 'community nourishment' mean to you?"

**0:08 – 0:10 (2 min) – Introducing SVMAN & Shared Impact**
*   **Speaker:** Marisol Vega, Emcee
*   **Script:** Brief overview of SVMAN's mission, "Neighbors Nourish" context.
*   **Interactive:** Chat prompt: "How long have you been connected to SVMAN?"

**0:10 – 0:20 (10 min) – Community Story I: Volunteer Perspective**
*   **Speaker:** Live Community Storyteller 1 (Volunteer)
*   **Script:** Mission Story (Volunteer perspective, 4-5 min), followed by brief Emcee Q&A (2-3 min).
*   **Prod Cue:** Storyteller spotlighted. Slides if applicable (minimal).
*   **Interactive:** Chat: Reactions encouraged; Emcee highlights questions from chat.

**0:20 – 0:25 (5 min) – Poll & Early Call to Action**
*   **Speaker:** Marisol Vega, Emcee
*   **Script:** Segue from story, introduce Poll 1.
*   **Poll 1:** "How familiar are you with South Valley Mutual Aid Network's work?" (Very, Somewhat, New to me).
*   **Prod Cue:** Tech Lead launches Poll 1 (60 sec). Emcee reviews results.
*   **Interactive:** Chat: "Post one word describing how that story made you feel."
*   **CTA:** (Soft) "If you're inspired, check out our volunteer opportunities in the chat!" (Chat Moderator posts volunteer link).

**0:25 – 0:35 (10 min) – Program Update: Our Impact in Action**
*   **Speaker:** Program Director (with slides)
*   **Script:** Presentation on key programs, recent successes, and upcoming initiatives (8 min).
*   **Prod Cue:** Program Director shares screen (slides).
*   **Interactive:** Chat: "What's a local need you wish SVMAN could address?" (Moderator monitors for themes).

**0:35 – 0:37 (2 min) – Pre-Recorded Video: Farmworker Family Perspective**
*   **Speaker:** Marisol Vega (intro)
*   **Script:** Brief intro to video, "A glimpse into the lives we touch."
*   **Prod Cue:** Tech Lead plays 2-min pre-recorded video. (Video should include subtitles).

**0:37 – 0:42 (5 min) – Transition & Q&A Introduction**
*   **Speaker:** Marisol Vega, Emcee
*   **Script:** Reflection on video, thank Program Director. Introduce Q&A process.
*   **Interactive:** Chat prompt: "Please use the Q&A box at the bottom of your screen to submit questions for our speakers." (Chat Moderator posts instructions).

**0:42 – 0:52 (10 min) – Live Q&A with Program Director & Community Storyteller I**
*   **Speaker:** Marisol Vega (moderator), Program Director, Community Storyteller I.
*   **Flow:** Emcee poses curated questions from Q&A box.
*   **Prod Cue:** Speakers spotlighted.
*   **Buffer time:** Can be shortened/extended based on engagement.

**0:52 – 0:57 (5 min) – Community Story II: Partner Pantry Leader**
*   **Speaker:** Live Community Storyteller 2 (Partner Pantry Leader)
*   **Script:** Mission Story (Pantry Leader perspective, 4-5 min).
*   **Prod Cue:** Storyteller spotlighted.
*   **Interactive:** Chat: Encouragements, insights.

**0:57 – 1:07 (10 min) – Fundraising Moment & Matched Gift Opportunity**
*   **Speaker:** Marisol Vega, Emcee
*   **Script:** 90-sec story (impact of funds), Specific Ask, Tiers, Match from La Tiendita.
*   **Prod Cue:** Tech Lead shares slide with CTA, tiers, donation link, match info. Chat Moderator posts donation link repeatedly.
*   **CTA:** "Please donate now at https://svman.org/give! Remember, your gift will be matched dollar-for-dollar by La Tiendita up to $5,000 during this live event!"
*   **Countdown:** Emcee announces every 2 min, "We have X minutes left for the match!"
*   **Interactive:** Poll 2: "What area of SVMAN's work are you most passionate about supporting?" (Food Distribution, Volunteer Support, Community Empowerment).

**1:07 – 1:12 (5 min) – Community Voices & Reflections**
*   **Speaker:** Marisol Vega, Emcee
*   **Script:** Brief thanks to donors (generic), introduce Poll 3.
*   **Poll 3:** "Thinking about today, what's one immediate action you feel inspired to take?" (Volunteer, Donate, Share info, Learn more).
*   **Interactive:** Chat prompt: "One word to describe your resolve after hearing these stories?"

**1:12 – 1:17 (5 min) – Next Steps & How to Stay Involved**
*   **Speaker:** Marisol Vega, Emcee
*   **Script:** Clear CTAs for volunteering, general donations (if match expired), sharing the word, survey link.
*   **Prod Cue:** Tech Lead shares "Next Steps" slide (volunteer link, donation link, social media handles, survey link). Chat Moderator posts all links.

**1:17 – 1:20 (3 min) – Closing Remarks & Thank You**
*   **Speaker:** Marisol Vega, Emcee
*   **Script:** Closing, Thanks, Acknowledgment (brief, warm).
*   **Prod Cue:** Emcee closes. Branded outro slide (logo, thank you, website). Music fades in.

**1:20 – 1:30 (10 min) – Post-Event Networking (Optional, informal)**
*   **Speaker:** Marisol Vega (remains on if participants stay)
*   **Prod Cue:** Chat remains open. Attendees can stay for informal Q&A or discussion. (Tech Lead monitors for issues/spam).
*   **Interactive:** Open chat for general feedback/questions.

---

### **3. Scripts and Talking Points**

**Opening (30–45 sec):**
*   **Marisol Vega:** "Hello everyone, and a warm welcome to Neighbors Nourish, the first-ever Virtual Town Hall for South Valley Mutual Aid Network! I'm Marisol Vega, your host and Program Coordinator, and we are so thrilled to have you join us tonight. Our purpose tonight is simple: to connect, to celebrate the incredible impact we create together, and to strengthen our mutual aid efforts for our farmworker families and neighbors in need. Get ready for inspiring stories, vital updates, and a chance to truly nourish our community spirit."

**Inclusive Welcome/Land Acknowledgment (if appropriate):**
*   **Marisol Vega:** "Before we dive in, we want to acknowledge that we gather virtually today on the ancestral lands of the [TBD - Specific local indigenous groups linked to South Valley], who have been stewards of this land for generations. We honor their enduring presence and their deep connection to the earth. We are also committed to making this event accessible to everyone. You’ll find live captions available [TBD - instructions for turning on captions], and we also have Spanish interpretation available for our Spanish-speaking attendees – please find instructions to access that channel in your chat box now. We want to hear from you throughout the event, so please use the chat for comments and reactions, and the Q&A feature for your questions."

**Donor/Volunteer Acknowledgment (20–30 sec):**
*   **Marisol Vega:** "Our work simply wouldn't be possible without each and every one of you. To our incredible volunteers, your dedication is the heartbeat of SVMAN. To our generous small-dollar donors, every contribution, big or small, directly translates into a meal, a clean blanket, or a moment of relief for a farmworker family. Thank you for being the backbone of our network, making true mutual aid a reality."

**Mission Story (60–90 sec) - *Example Outline for Community Storyteller 1 (Volunteer)***:
*   **Storyteller 1:** "Good evening, everyone. My name is [Storyteller's Name], and I've been a volunteer with SVMAN for [X months/years]. What drew me to SVMAN was seeing the profound need right here in our South Valley community, especially among our farmworker neighbors who work so incredibly hard often with so little. I remember one specific Saturday [vivid, specific detail – e.g., "loading boxes in the rain," "the smile of a child receiving a fresh apple"]. The family had just arrived, and through our efforts, they received not only food but also [specific outcome – e.g., 'a warm pair of donated children's shoes']. It wasn't just about the items; it was the look of relief, the gratitude in their eyes. That day, I saw firsthand how our volunteers, our donors, and SVMAN’s network created *immediate*, *tangible* support. It reminds me why I show up every week – because every meal, every helping hand, makes a real difference in someone's life."

**Closing (30–45 sec):**
*   **Marisol Vega:** "As we wrap up our first 'Neighbors Nourish' Town Hall, I want to extend a heartfelt thank you to all our speakers, our incredible team, and most importantly, to you—our community. Your presence tonight reminds us that mutual aid isn't just a concept; it's a living, breathing network of compassion. Please, consider taking a next step: volunteer with us, make a donation, or simply share what you learned tonight with a friend. Look out for a follow-up email from us with the recording and links to get further involved. Together, we truly nourish our neighbors. Thank you, and good night!"

### **4. Technical/Production Checklist**

**Audio:**
*   [ ] All speakers & Emcee conducted pre-event mic checks.
*   [ ] Backup microphone/headset available for each presenter.
*   [ ] Tech Lead knows how to mute/unmute participants, and force mute if necessary.
*   [ ] Background music levels tested (pre-show/outro).
*   [ ] Spanish interpreter channel sound check completed.

**Lighting/Background:**
*   [ ] All speakers confirmed good lighting (front-lit, no harsh backlighting).
*   [ ] Quiet, distraction-free environment for all presenters.
*   [ ] Branded virtual backgrounds available (or neutral, professional backdrops).

**Slides:**
*   [ ] All slides finalized and reviewed for branding consistency.
*   [ ] Font size 24pt+ for readability.
*   [ ] High contrast color scheme.
*   [ ] Minimal text (bullet points, keywords).
*   [ ] All images have alt text descriptions for future use/review.
*   [ ] Back-up slide deck held by Tech Lead.

**Accessibility:**
*   [ ] Zoom auto-captioning enabled.
*   [ ] Spanish interpretation channel configured and tested.
*   [ ] Instructions for captioning/interpretation clear for attendees (chat/verbal).
*   [ ] Emcee/speakers briefed on visual descriptions for slides/video.

**Speaker Tech Checks (24–48 hrs prior):**
*   [ ] Individual calls with all 5 speakers.
*   [ ] Confirm reliable internet connection.
*   [ ] Test audio/video (webcam quality).
*   [ ] Practice screen sharing (Program Director).
*   [ ] Brief run-through of their segment timing.
*   [ ] Confirm presence of backup slides if sharing fails.

**Screen share permissions:**
*   [ ] Only Host/Co-hosts allowed to screen share in Zoom settings.
*   [ ] Tech Lead ensures Program Director has co-host status for seamless sharing.

**Backup deck with Tech Lead:**
*   [ ] Tech Lead has a copy of all presentation slides ready to share if a speaker has technical difficulties.

---

### **5. Follow-Up Plan**

**Within 48 hours:**

**Segmented Emails:**

*   **Attendees (150–200 words):**
    *   **Subject Line:** Thank you for Nourishing Our Neighbors! [Recording + Next Steps]
    *   **Content:**
        *   Warm thank you for attending.
        *   Link to event recording (Attendees Only Access).
        *   Key highlights/takeaways.
        *   **CTA 1:** Donate (reiterate match if still active/how funds were matched if already ended + general giving) https://svman.org/give.
        *   **CTA 2:** Volunteer signup link.
        *   **CTA 3:** Survey link (emphasize feedback is valued).
        *   Social media links.
*   **No-shows (100–150 words):**
    *   **Subject Line:** We Missed You! Catch Up on Neighbors Nourish Here
    *   **Content:**
        *   "Sorry we missed you!"
        *   Briefly state what they missed (inspiring stories, key updates).
        *   Link to event recording (Attendees Only Access).
        *   **CTA 1:** Donate opportunity https://svman.org/give.
        *   **CTA 2:** Volunteer signup link.
        *   Upcoming opportunities/events.

    *   **Subject Line:** Your Gift is Already Making a Difference! Thank You from SVMAN
    *   **Content:**
        *   Personalized gratitude for their specific donation.
        *   Reiterate impact (e.g., "Your $50 provides X meals").
        *   Mention the match where applicable ("Your gift, doubled by La Tiendita...").
        *   Briefly explain what's next for SVMAN.
        *   Invite to get more involved (volunteer, share story).
        *   Contact for questions/further engagement.

**Survey (max 5 questions):**
*   **Platform:** Google Forms or similar free survey tool.
*   **Questions:**
    1.  Overall, how would you rate your experience at the Neighbors Nourish Virtual Town Hall? (Scale of 1-5, 5 being excellent)
    2.  What was the most valuable/impactful part of the event for you? (Open-ended)
    3.  Did you experience any technical difficulties during the event? If so, please briefly describe. (Yes/No + short open-ended)
    4.  What topics or issues related to mutual aid for farmworker families would you like SVMAN to cover in future events? (Open-ended)

*   Targeted links in email follow-ups as outlined above.

    *   "What an incredible night at our first-ever Neighbors Nourish Virtual Town Hall! Huge thanks to everyone who joined us to celebrate community, share stories, and ignite support for our farmworker families. Your presence truly nourishes our mission! Missed it? Link in bio for the replay! #NeighborsNourish #SVMutualAid #CommunityStrong"

    *   "Tonight, we heard powerful stories of resilience and mutual aid. From providing warm meals to essential supplies, your support makes a profound difference. Feeling inspired? There's still time to donate and help us reach more families! Every dollar counts. Link in bio to give: https://svman.org/give #SupportFarmworkers #MutualAid #Giveback"

    *   "Huge thanks to our incredible speakers, volunteers, and the dedicated team behind Neighbors Nourish! We're already planning how to build on this energy. What was YOUR favorite moment from the Town Hall? Tell us below! 👇 #SVMANTeam #CommunityLove #VirtualEventSuccess"

### **6. Success Metrics**

**Targets:**
*   **Registration-to-attendance conversion rate:** 55%
*   **Retention rate (percentage who stay through full event):** 70%
*   **Engagement rate (percentage participating in polls/chat):** 65%
*   **Q&A participation (questions submitted):** 15 unique questions
*   **Donation/pledge conversions (percentage and dollars):** 8% donor conversion / $12,000 raised total
